sections.overnight: The US session delivered the sharpest single-day decline since the election rally began. $637 million in liquidations cleared leveraged longs as Bitcoin dropped from $91,000 to $85,945. ETF outflows hit $540 million—the largest daily exit in two months.
sections.the_setup: Asia inherits a damaged chart. The rally's trendline from November is broken, and the first meaningful support sits at $82,000. Perpetual funding has normalized, suggesting the leverage flush is complete, but that doesn't mean buyers are ready.
sections.what_matters: Hong Kong spot ETF volumes will signal regional institutional appetite. Japan's FSA meets this week on crypto custody rules—any tightening could pressure regional sentiment. Watch whether Korean retail, often a leading indicator, steps in or stays away.
sections.the_take: The overnight move was violent but healthy. Markets needed to reset positioning. The next 48 hours will reveal whether this is a buying opportunity or the start of something worse.
